body.head.byline: By DIANE CARDWELL; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: Mayor Michael R Bloomberg announces that World Trade Center Memorial Foundation has raised more than $300 million toward its $350 million goal; money is to pay capital and planning costs as well as an endowment to operate memorial and museum; foundation board selects Thinc Design as lead exhibition design firm (S)

block.p: The World Trade Center Memorial Foundation has raised more than $300 million toward its $350 million goal, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg announced yesterday, with more than $165 million raised since he took over as chairman of the foundation roughly six months ago. The money, which includes gifts from across the country and overseas, is to pay capital and planning costs as well as an endowment to operate the memorial and museum. Officials announced yesterday that the foundation board had selected Thinc Design as the lead exhibition design firm.
